com.googlecode.aluminumproject.templates

Interface ActionContext

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultActionContext

    public interface ActionContext
    The context in which an action is created and executed. It will be used by action elements. Before an action is executed, its context can be modified by action contributions and/or action interceptors.

    An action context has a number of phases, which means that not every part of the context is accessible all of the time (e.g. the action itself is not available until it is created). For the same reason, not every part of the action context can be changed during every phase (e.g. after the contribution phase, it does no longer make sense to add action contributions).

      • getConfiguration

        Configuration getConfiguration()
        Returns the configuration of the template processor that executes the action.
        Returns:
        the current configuration

        Returns the descriptor of the created action.
        Returns:
        the action's descriptor

        Returns the factory that will be used to create the action.
        Returns:
        the action's action factory

        the context that will be used

        Returns the writer that the action will use.
        Returns:

        void setWriter(Writer writer)
        Replaces the writer that the action will use.

      • getParameters

        Map<String,ActionParameter> getParameters()
        Returns the parameters that will be used to create the action.
        Returns:
        the action parameters that will be used

      • addParameter

        void addParameter(String name,
                ActionParameter parameter)
                  throws AluminumException
        Adds an action parameter to the set of parameters that the action will be created with.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the parameter to add
        parameter - the parameter to add
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when an action has already been created

      • getActionContributionFactories

        Map<ActionContributionDescriptor,ActionContributionFactory> getActionContributionFactories()
        Returns the factories of the action contributions that will be made to the action.
        Returns:
        the action's contribution factories

      • addActionContribution

        void addActionContribution(ActionContributionDescriptor descriptor,
                         ActionContributionFactory contributionFactory)
                           throws AluminumException
        Adds an action contribution to the set of action contributions that will be made to the action.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - the descriptor of the action contribution factory
        contributionFactory - the factory that will create the action contribution
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when it is too late to add an action contribution

      • getAction

        Action getAction()
        Returns the action that will be executed.
        Returns:
        the executed action

      • setAction

        void setAction(Action action)
               throws AluminumException
        Sets the action that will be executed.
        Parameters:
        action - the action to execute
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when an action has already been created

      • addInterceptor

        void addInterceptor(ActionInterceptor interceptor)
                    throws AluminumException
        Adds an interceptor to this action context. The later an action interceptor is added, the higher its priority.
        Parameters:
        interceptor - the interceptor to add
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when the interceptor has no chance of running

      • getPhase

        ActionPhase getPhase()
        Returns the current phase of this action context.
        Returns:
        this action context's current phase

      • proceed

        void proceed()
             throws AluminumException
        Proceeds this action context by running the next interceptor of the current phase. If there are no more interceptors to run, this method does nothing.
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when the interceptor can't be run
